recommendations: Axel Turn is a jump in which the skater rotates 360 degrees in the air, landing on the back foot.. For practicing Axel Turn as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Box jumps, Skater jumps, Plyometric lunges for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Begin in B-plus position., Swing arms forward, then up into crossed position., Jump off back foot, bringing legs into crossed position., Rotate 360 degrees, maintaining crossed leg position., Land on the back foot, bending knees to absorb impact. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.

Axel Turn is a jump in which the skater rotates 360 degrees in the air, landing on the back foot.. For practicing Axel Turn as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Jumping jacks, Single-leg hops, Tuck jumps for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Start in B-plus position., Swing arms forward and jump off back foot., Rotate 360 degrees with legs crossed., Land on the back foot., Practice with a half turn first. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.

Jazz Contraction is a contraction of the muscles in the back of the legs, which is used to create a higher jump.. For practicing Jazz Contraction as a/an advanced performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Pilates teaser, Yoga wheel pose, Dance floor work for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart., Bend knees, lowering into deep plié., Curve spine forward, engaging core., Drop head, maintaining neck alignment., Incorporate dynamic full-body movements. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.
